node.title: First COVID-19 case recorded in remote NT community of Lajamanu, bringing Katherine cluster to 60
node.alt: shadowed silhouettes around woman in green shirt and black blazer speaking at a lectern
node.description: One new local case of COVID-19 has been recorded in the Northern Territory overnight, in the remote community of Lajamanu. It is the first case to be recorded in that community.
node.content: ["The Northern Territory has recorded one new case of COVID-19 linked to the Katherine region cluster in the past 24 hours.", "That\u00a0case is in a 45-year-old man from the remote community of Lajamanu in Central Australia.", "He is fully vaccinated.", "It is the first case to be recorded in Lajamanu, which went into lockdown on Saturday after wastewater samples tested positive to COVID-19.", "Lockdown orders were lifted in Lajamanu yesterday and Health Minister Natasha Fyles said the community would\u00a0remain under lockout rules only.", "Ms Fyles said the man would be transferred to the Howard Springs COVID\u00a0quarantine facility near Darwin.", "He has 13 close contacts, who will also be transported to the centre.", "His positive test result takes the total number of cases part of the outbreak to 60.", "Ms Fyles said the man's viral load was currently quite low.", "\"It could be two scenarios: It could be that he's coming off his illness and it's just what is left, or it could be that he has recently acquired COVID-19,\" she said.", "She said authorities were currently interviewing the man to determine his recent movements, including any contact he may have had with people from Katherine.", "Acting Chief Health Officer Charles Pain thanked the Lajamanu community for their patience with lockdown and lockout restrictions and for coming forward for testing and vaccination.", "\"I suppose it's what we feared, but it's a single case,\" he said.", "\"As we said yesterday, we didn't think there was widespread transmission but this case does mean we need to have a further push and effort to see if there's been any other further spread.\"", "More to come."]
